member.name: E:Microsoft.Practices.Prism.Commands.CompositeCommand.CanExecuteChanged
member.summary: Occurs when any of the registered commands raise . You must keep a hard reference to the handler to avoid garbage collection and unexpected results. See remarks for more information.
member.remarks: When subscribing to the event using code (not when binding using XAML) will need to keep a hard reference to the event handler. This is to prevent garbage collection of the event handler because the command implements the Weak Event pattern so it does not have a hard reference to this handler. An example implementation can be seen in the CompositeCommand and CommandBehaviorBase classes. In most scenarios, there is no reason to sign up to the CanExecuteChanged event directly, but if you do, you are responsible for maintaining the reference.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.Prism.ExceptionExtensions.GetRootException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Looks at all the inner exceptions of the parameter to find the most likely root cause of the exception. This works by skipping all registered exception types.
member.remarks: This method is not 100% accurate and should only be used to point a developer into the most likely direction. It should not be used to replace the Inner Exception stack of an exception, because this might hide required exception information.
member.param: The exception that will provide the list of inner exeptions to examine.
member.returns: The exception that most likely caused the exception to occur. If it can't find the root exception, it will return the value itself.

The ref value will also be used by the to determine which to use. For example, if the ref property can be converted to an URL, it the XapModuleTypeLoader will be used (Only available in the Silverlight version of CAL).
